public class NCLCompoundAction<T extends NCLElement,Ea extends NCLAction,Ep extends NCLConnectorParam,Er extends NCLRoleElement>
extends ParamElement<T>
implements NCLAction<T,Ep,Er>

Class that represents a connector compound action.
This element defines the attributes:

  • operator - compound action operator. This attribute is required.
  • delay - delay waited by the action. This attribute is optional.

This element has as children the elements:
  • simpleAction - element representing a connector action. The compound action can have none or several action elements.
  • compundAction - element representing a connector action. The compound action can have none or several action elements.
Note that the compound action must have at least two actions.

setOperator

public void setOperator(NCLActionOperator operator)
                 throws XMLException
Sets the compound action operator. This attribute is required and can not be set to null.
The operator attribute relates the compound action children elements. Its possible values are "par" and "seq" and are defined in the enumeration NCLActionOperator.
Using a "par" operator means that the actions of the compound action will be executed in any order. Using a "seq" operator means that the actions of the compound action will be executed in a predetermined order.

Parameters:
operator - element representing the compound action operator from the enumeration NCLActionOperator.
Throws:
XMLException - if the element representing the operator is null.

getOperator

public NCLActionOperator getOperator()
Returns the compound action operator or null if the attribute is not defined.
The operator attribute relates the compound action children elements. Its possible values are "par" and "seq" and are defined in the enumeration NCLActionOperator.
Using a "par" operator means that the actions of the compound action will be executed in any order. Using a "seq" operator means that the actions of the compound action will be executed in a predetermined order.

Returns:
element representing the compound action operator from the enumeration NCLActionOperator or null if the attribute is not defined.

setDelay

public void setDelay(java.lang.Object delay)
              throws XMLException
Description copied from interface: NCLAction
Sets the delay waited by the action. This attribute is optional. Set the delay to null to erase a delay already defined.
The delay can be set as a parameter, in which case its value is defined by the link that uses the connector where this action is.
In case the attribute value is defined by a parameter, the parameter must be defined in the same connector where this attribute assessment it.

Specified by:
setDelay in interface NCLAction<T extends NCLElement,Ep extends NCLConnectorParam,Er extends NCLRoleElement>
Parameters:
delay - double, string or connector parameter representing the delay or null to erase a delay already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if an error occur while creating the delay value.

The delay can be set as a parameter, in which case its value is defined by the link that uses the connector where this action is.
In case the attribute value is defined by a parameter, the parameter must be defined in the same connector where this attribute assessment it.

Specified by:
getDelay in interface NCLAction<T extends NCLElement,Ep extends NCLConnectorParam,Er extends NCLRoleElement>
Returns:
double, string or connector parameter representing the delay or null if the attribute is not defined.
